Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Nisin S (natural AMPs; lantibiotic, class 1 bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; UCSS1b)
Sequence Information.Source: Ligilactobacillus salivariusP1CEA3, isolated from the gastrointestinal tract (GIT); pig microbiota:Gut, symbiont bacteria

Literature.Author: Sevillano E, Peña N, Lafuente I, Cintas LM, Muñoz-Atienza E, Hernández PE, Borrero J. 2023
Literature.Reference: Int J Mol Sci. 2023 Apr 6;24(7):6813. doi: 10.3390/ijms24076813.Pub-Med.
Literature.Title: Nisin S, a Novel Nisin Variant Produced by Ligilactobacillus salivarius P1CEA3.

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: detected in supernatant and purified in the same way as nisin A.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (79.41%) toNisin AC: 15%: T: 15% G: 12%. The structure is proposed to be the same as nisin A except for some amino acid changes, inlcuding I4Y, N20T, T25S, H27G, S29H, I30V, and V32I.Activity: inhibition zone assay: active against indicator Gram-positive strains E. faecalis 12Ep11 (+++), L. seeligeri CECT 917 (+++), L. monocytogenes CECT 4032 (++), L. innocua CECT 910 (++), S. aureus ZTA11/00117ST or DICM10/00243 (++), S. epidermidis DICM15/00071 (++), S. pseudintermedius ICM21/02217 (++), S. suis CECT 958 or serotype 1 DICM10/01182–1C (++), S. iniae ATCC 29178 (++), S. agalactiae DICM11/00863 (+++), S. dysgalactiae VSE16/01903A (+++), S. equi zooepidermicus VSE16/00697 (++), C. ulcerans ICM19/00922–1B (++), C. pseudotuberculosis Cam2 (++), C.  mastitidis INDA2 (++), C.bovis AM3 (-), B.cereus ICM17/00252 (-), T. pyogenes ICM17/02091–1 (++), E. rhusiopathiae ICM21/01900 (+++), C. perfringens DICM15/00067–5A (+++), E. coli DH5alpha (+), and S.paratyphi CECT 554 (-) Note -= no inhibition, += <5 mm, ++= 5–10 mm, +++= >10 mm.
